symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.severity: Moderate (39°C or higher) in 30-40% of cases

symptoms.name: Dehydration
symptoms.severity: Can range from mild to severe, potentially fatal
symptoms.pattern: Develops due to fluid loss from diarrhea and vomiting

symptoms.name: Electrolyte imbalance
symptoms.severity: Can be severe in severe cases

symptoms.name: Seizures
symptoms.severity: Occurs in a small percentage of hospitalized children

symptoms.name: Neurologic symptoms
symptoms.severity: Variable, can include encephalitis, encephalopathy, and cerebellitis

risk_factors: Immunodeficiency (severe T cell and combined T and B cell deficiencies)

diagnostic_criteria.required: Detection of rotavirus in fecal specimens using commercially available assays
diagnostic_criteria.supportive: Clinical presentation consistent with rotaviral gastroenteritis (e.g., acute onset of watery diarrhea, vomiting, fever)
